description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Mykonos Town" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Mykonos Town

places.generalDescription: Super Paradise Beach Club is a vibrant and inclusive beach club and hotel located at the east end of Super Paradise beach. The club offers a lively party atmosphere with a bar, restaurant, pool, and multi-level space designed with traditional Cycladic architecture. It's known for its flirtatious charm and carefree vibe, attracting celebrities, models, and partygoers to enjoy DJ performances at night.

sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds
Best 15+ Things to Do in Mykonos

places.name: Super Paradise Beach Club

reviews.text: My friends and I rented cabanas and sun beds for day long beach time on two different days and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Our server, Christi, went above and beyond. He is someone that is passionate about their job and goes the extra mile beyond just getting you drinks and food to ensure you have a great time. He was very attentive, brought positive high energy, was engaging, and would even recognize when the group was feeling a bit low energy and help by making us laugh, getting us to dance, and bringing over complimentary shots. The food was well-portioned and tasty. The drinks were top notch. The live dancers were a nice touch to get the dance floor going to transition the daytime beach to sundown party vibe. The DJ was fun and we had fun dancing. This beach club is on the pricier side but felt it offered a wide variety of high quality entertainment from beach lounging, partying, dancing, and eating. The towels, sun beds and cabanas were worth it and allowed us to enjoy the beach from morning to night.

Such a pretty location, friendly staff, and yummy food. Huge appreciation to the staff for the surprise at the end of my visit! I had pre-booked two chairs for my mom and me, but my mom didn't make it due to falling ill, so I went solo! My day was extremely relaxing and the staff were attentive, and when I asked for my food and drink bill, they kindly informed me it was on the house since I had paid for two chairs already. Thank you, Super Paradise! Such a wonderful end to my trip to Greece.

Such a good experience in this beautiful beach club. Drinks and food were amazing. We didn't book sun beds but easily got them within 20 minutes of waiting which went really quick with all the good music and vibes. Top service too with waiters tending to the beds.

places.generalDescription: The Windmills of Mykonos, located at Kato Mili and within walking distance from Mykonos Town, are an iconic feature of the island. Perched on the highest hill, these 16 historic windmills offer a plethora of entertainment options and are a popular spot for capturing stunning sunset views. Seven of these 17th-century windmills have been beautifully restored in the Kato Mili region, providing visitors with a glimpse into their historical significance.

sources.snippet: Stars of countless selfies, the seven windmills silently overlooking Hora’s harbor are icons of the island and one of Mykonos' best easy hikes. Take the short walk up the small hill on which they perch and watch ferries arriving with ever-more holiday-makers. The panoramic views from this vantage point are breathtaking and provide an excellent backdrop for memorable photographs.
sources.shortName: 20 best things to do in Mykonos

sources.snippet: One of the most iconic sights on the island stands on a hill on the border of Mykonos Town; the Mykonos Windmills.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do in Mykonos, According to Local Experts

sources.snippet: Also known as Kato Milli, the windmills are within walking distance of the Old Port. Most of the Cycladic islands had windmills operating from the 16th until the late 19th century. They are probably the most notable and picturesque attractions in town.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Places for an Engagement

sources.snippet: Throughout history, Mykonos was known across Greece for its wheat production. During its height, there were over 20 windmills spread around the island, each one vital for its production and the island’s economy.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things To Do in Mykonos in 2023

sources.snippet: Extend your vistas to infinity, get wonderfully lost in a breathtaking panorama and let the scarlet sunset ignite your senses.
sources.shortName: The most romantic spots for couples in Mykonos

places.name: Windmills of Mykonos

reviews.text:
We stopped in Mykonos Greece while on a cruise of the Mediterranean.  The sight from the sea as our ship approached was unbelievably beautiful. And as we climbed up to the village and walked over to see the windmills, picture perfect views were
everywhere.
The windmills were beautiful.  We took lots of pictures and the found lots of choices for drinks and food.

Great views and lovely place to visit. Very big tourist destination and caters to shopping. However, there are some nice bakeries and places to eat scattered throughout. Huge photo opportunities as a traveler.

One of Mykonos top landmarks, always full of people so I decided to wake up earlier and be there around 6:15 am for sunrise. You can see the results, not a single person did so and I had a lot of time to change my spots and play with sun. Go there between 6:00 and 6:30 and skip the crowds and boring daily photos with tens of other people. I am not a photographer, I just wanted to try my luck to wake up earlier and every day there were not a single individual. And those mills are simply stunning

places.generalDescription: Kastro's Restaurant is a charming Mediterranean spot located in the scenic area of Little Venice in Mykonos Town. It offers a laid-back atmosphere with a waterside terrace where guests can enjoy stunning sea views and delicious food. The restaurant is known for its vibrant nightlife, making it popular among people from all over the world who come to experience the lively bar scene and romantic sunsets.

sources.snippet: Kastros: The Little Venice area right on the edge of Chora has numerous bars right on the cliffside of the water, Kastros being one of them. There are many to choose from you and you might even get splashed by crashing waves!
sources.shortName: Have a Romantic Honeymoon in Mykonos, Greece

places.name: Kastro's Restaurant

reviews.text: One of the best restaurant on Mykonos, we came 2 times during our trip. Absolutely blown away with taste and quality of ingredients. Never tried better linguine with sea food in my life! Top of the top!

Even though we visited at late lunch hour, the place was full. We seated at the bar first but shifted to indoor table later. Everything was nice, and our favorite dish was a risotto. Every plate was presented nicely, the idea of playing with the color made each dish fun and exciting.

Very nice restaurant. View of balcony is super. Go around sunset time. And be sure to make reservation couple days earlier. Food is good, wines are wide variety. Owner Alex is nice man. Smiley and talkative. He is also generous and hospitable.

places.address: Agion Anargyron 1, P.O.Box 69 Paraportiani Church,Little venice, Mikonos 846 00, Greece

places.generalDescription: Scorpios is a stylish and lively beachfront venue that offers local cuisine, creative drinks, and regular entertainment. Unlike other party spots in Mykonos popular with college students, Scorpios attracts a more sophisticated crowd of young professionals in their late 20s to 40s. The beach club boasts expansive and stunning architecture resembling modern homes blended with natural elements like stone, thatch, bamboo, and driftwood.

sources.snippet: Pair your spree with afternoon-lounging turned late-night partying at one of the many beach clubs in the area; there’s neighboring Nammos, of course, but Scorpios, Kalua, and Super Paradise are also nearby.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds

places.name: Scorpios

reviews.text: A spacious seaside restaurant with stunning ocean views. After enjoying your meal, you can stroll down to the beach to take in the sea breeze and the sound of the waves. There's a live DJ spinning music by the shore, adding to the lively, relaxed vibe. The atmosphere is vibrant and fun-though it can get quite crowded, especially in the evenings

I visit this club every summer, and it remains one of the best on the island for its vibrant atmosphere and elegant, high-class parties.

This summer, we were a group of four and had a reservation which I highly recommend. Without reservation, you might end up waiting in a long line, and entry is left to the discretion of security girl, who are known to be selective. During August, many couples and even groups of friends were turned away at the door. Things are a bit more relaxed in September.

We've tried the restaurant in the past, but this year we focused on the sunset party experience, which was fantastic. Delicious cocktails, great music, and an unbeatable vibe.

Highly recommended if you're looking for a premium party experience on the island.

Prices:
•	Cocktails: €23–€25
•	Champagne: from €40/glass and up
•	Desserts: €28–€42

Other details:
•	The toilets were clean and well-serviced.
•	Dress code: white is highly encouraged for an elegant look.

Scorpios is my absolute favourite place in Mykonos. Nothing else comes close to the energy, the vibe and the way it just completely transports you. The setting is beyond stunning, with earthy tones, natural textures and one of the most beautiful sunset views on the island. Everything feels so intentional yet effortless, from the layout to the lighting to the flow of the space.

But the real magic is in the music. The music is everything. It sets the rhythm of the entire experience, starting slow and soulful during the day, then gradually building into deep, hypnotic beats as the sun goes down. It moves through you and creates a connection between the people, the space and the sea. It's more than a soundtrack – it's the heartbeat of the place.

The food is fresh, delicious and beautifully presented. The seafood dishes are a must. Everything we tried was full of flavour and felt light, clean and nourishing. Service was warm, present and smooth from start to finish.

Every time I'm in Mykonos, Scorpios is a must. It's where the best memories are made and where you feel something real. A place that stays with you long after you leave.

places.generalDescription: Vegera Restaurant Cafe Bar in Mykonos is a trendy choice offering local fare, including seafood and meat plates, as well as breakfast, wine, and cocktails. Housed in a traditional space that was once a historic coffee shop, Vegera is the perfect spot for coffee, brunch, meals, and drinks. The menu features delicious options such as omelets, club sandwiches, salads, seafood pasta dishes, T-bone steak, vegetarian dishes and fresh fish delicacies.

sources.snippet: Vegera Mykonos: The boardwalk in Mykonos is crawling with food destinations. I always recommend those with the highest ratings. So many people go through Mykonos every year, so the ratings can tell you a lot!
sources.shortName: Have a Romantic Honeymoon in Mykonos, Greece

places.name: Vegera Restaurant Cafe Bar Mykonos

reviews.text: This place is AMAZING. We went here two days in a row. Alex the host is the sweetest guy and he has the best style! So friendly and the whole staff made sure we were taken care of. The food was 10/10. Highly recommend!

This restaurant was recommended by my taxi driver from the port into Mykonos town.  It did not disappoint. In fact, it was so good that we went there twice during our three day stay.  The food was fantastic, and the service was impeccable.  Lamb chops and chicken with pasta in cream sauce were amazing .  Fotini, our waitress, Is an absolute gem.  I wish I would've gotten the names of others there because they were also fantastic.  This place contributed to our unforgettable experience in this beautiful island.

We've been to Vegera Mykonos three days in a row - that's how amazing this place is!
The food is absolutely delicious, with rich flavors and fresh ingredients that make every dish a joy. The location is perfect, right by the sea, with a stunning view that adds so much to the atmosphere.
The design of the restaurant is beautiful and welcoming - it's truly a place you want to stay and enjoy for hours. But what really makes this place special is the staff: the waiters are incredibly friendly, always smiling, giving genuine personal recommendations, and making you feel like a guest, not just a customer.
This is more than just a restaurant - it's an experience. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Mykonos!

places.address: Cyclades, Old port, Akti Kampani, Mikonos 846 00, Greece

places.generalDescription: View of Alefkandra, also known as Little Venice, is a charming and picturesque neighborhood in Mykonos Town on the Greek island of Mykonos. This iconic area is famous for its unique architecture, vibrant atmosphere, and stunning waterfront views that resemble the city of Venice. The district began to be built in the 18th century and was home to wealthy merchants and captains. Visitors can enjoy one of the most beautiful sunsets in Greece from this location.

sources.snippet: The Windmills is a local trademark a short walk from the Chora. Sitting cosily atop a hill, right above the water, they are a popular attraction not only for its historical background but also the scenic Mykonos sunset views you can get from up there. Built in the 16th century, they offer you the chance to see how the islanders used to grind wheat to make flour by harnessing wind power back in the day.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Mykonos: The Ultimate Guide

places.name: View of Alefkandra (Little Venice)

reviews.text: Little Venice is one of the famous landmark of Mykonos and sunset views are stunning. I love the place for nice scenery especially in sunset.

Upon visiting Mykonoy, I found it to be a beautiful place in the areas that my wife and I had the opportunity to explore. The cleanliness was everywhere, and the people aren't very friendly unless they want to sell you something, but I respect their way of thinking because it's their land, and among them, it's understood why they are like that.

Little Venice is undeniably one of Mykonos's crown jewels. It beautifully blends historic charm with a lively contemporary atmosphere, offering breathtaking views and unforgettable moments. Whether you're there for the magical sunsets, a romantic dinner, or just to admire the unique architecture, Little Venice is an essential stop that truly captures the spirit and beauty of Mykonos.

places.generalDescription: Agios Stefanos Beach, located on the west coast of Mykonos, just north of the ferry port, offers a serene escape from the island's lively atmosphere. Families with children, couples, and older visitors all appreciate its unique ambiance. The soft sandy beach is never too crowded even during peak season and provides a perfect tourist experience with accommodations, restaurants, and bars nearby. This low-key sunbathing spot is protected by imposing cliffs and remains unbothered by beach clubs.

sources.snippet: Agios Stefanos is the closest beach to town, and it is about 100 meters (120 yards) long. It is north of Troulos and the new port. It is much less windy, but it can get very crowded during the summertime.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Places for an Engagement

places.name: Agios Stefanos Beach

reviews.text: Very Calm. Few Restaurants around. The water is cold but once you go in is perfect. Walking distance from the cruise port.

So Nice. Very beautiful and quiet cove with the sea always flat and with very beautiful colors, wonderful view with Kastri Island and its church in front! You can also find artifacts of a temple practically on the sea! Really very nice to see

The most relaxing beach on the island, IMO.
There is a small section dedicated to sunbeds & umbrellas but the rest of the beach is quiet and peaceful. No loud or obnoxious beach clubs here!
Soft sand with crystal-clear waters - perfect for swimming.

places.generalDescription: The Church of Panagia Paraportiani is a unique complex of five joined churches located in the Kastro neighborhood. Built in the 17th century, it stands out as an admirable architectural monument and a characteristic image of Cycladic temples. The church's whitewashed exterior and unconventional design reflect the island's vernacular architecture and Cycladic flair.

sources.snippet: Though the translated name may be mundane (‘Our Lady of the Side Gate’), everything else about this geometric church complex is extraordinary. Five separate chapels are linked by a dazzling white-washed exterior under a low dome. Look for the subtle differences of the four on the ground-level, then find the tiny stairs leading to the fifth.
sources.shortName: 20 best things to do in Mykonos

sources.snippet: Don’t miss Panagia Paraportiani, a complex of churches built on top of each other between the 14th and 17th centuries; they’re the most photographed churches on the island but, if you get your timing right, you may catch them sans crowds.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds
16 Best Things To Do in Mykonos, According to Local Experts

sources.snippet: Even if you are not too much into religious sites, Panagia Paraportiani is certainly not to be missed. In reality, it is not a single church like all the others you have probably already seen, rather than a complex of five different chapels, built one almost on top of the other!. To make things even more exciting, its architecture is so exemplary that the infamous Le Corbusier (a renowned architectural pioneer) once wrote that after he had seen Panagia Paraportiani church, he knew that he himself hadn’t built anything worthwhile!.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Mykonos: The Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: On the western side of Chora, before you get to Little Venice you will find the imposing Paraportiani Church. It stands in the historic area known as "Kastro" or castle area, the oldest section of town. Paraportiani evolved over two hundred years beginning in 1475.
sources.shortName: REINVENTING THE ROMANTIC ESCAPE IN MYKONOS WITH ST. JOHN

sources.snippet: If you have to see only one landmark of the island, let it be Paraportiani. It is, in reality, a complex of five churches, named after its location between the sea and the side door of the castle. ‘Para’ in Greek means’ next to,’ while ‘porta’ means ‘door.’
sources.shortName: Mykonos Honeymoon Guide 2025: Romantic Escapes and Tips

sources.snippet: There are 365 churches on the island (one for each day of the year). However, the Paraportiani Church is definitely the most important. It is located at the entrance of Kastro neighborhood, and it dates back to the Byzantine era.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST Places for an Engagement

sources.snippet: Maybe the most instagrammable landmark in Mykonos, this stunningly picturesque, whitewashed cluster of five churches built inside a castle by the sea is the most ideal setting for romantic moments to cherish forever.
sources.shortName: The most romantic spots for couples in Mykonos
21 Best Things To Do in Mykonos in 2023

sources.siteName: Luxury Villa Rentals in Mykonos Greece
sources.shortName: Mykonos for Couples - The Ultimate Guide

places.name: Church of Panagia Paraportiani

reviews.text: Nice attraction to visit in Mykonos . Tickets cost 2 Euros. They have small museums upstairs. Small church gift shop right side from entrance. The village itself is nice and it has nice coffee shops and restaurants. There is also good gift shop close by in the village for souvenirs.
As the “best” attraction in Mykonos, not really as good as expected. It doesn't look that appealing when seeing it in person.
Located at one edge of mykonos, next to the old ruins of the castle, is this small beautiful church. Magical and very romantic.. came almost sunset, enjoyed the beautiful view as well..

places.generalDescription: Kadena Restaurant is a popular dining spot in Mykonos town, conveniently located just a short walk from the iconic Church of Panagia Paraportiani. The restaurant offers a diverse menu featuring fresh seafood, Mediterranean dishes, and flavorful salads. With its outdoor seating, diners can enjoy stunning views of the surrounding landscapes while savoring their meals.

sources.shortName: Have a Romantic Honeymoon in Mykonos, Greece

places.name: Kadena

reviews.text: The servers here were very friendly! I ordered this honey and soy chicken which was absolutely delicious. We had a fairly  large group and everyone enjoyed their meal. One person did have an issue with their burger and the server did not charge us for it and apologized. He also gifted us a bottle of local Greek alcohol to drink. I highly recommend grabbing a meal here. The venue is also lovely and located right in front of the waterfront for beautiful views of the water.

This restaurant was amazing! We initially sat down for the wonderful view, but we were blown away with the food. We had the moussaka (incredible!), tiramisu, and the appetizer that was cheese, honey and pistachio. We have been in Greece for a while and this was our best meal we had. Also a very impressive wine list!

Excellent food, atmosphere, and location. We came here to Mykonos on a cruise ship and were happy to have found this place. We would happily dine here again in the future. We had Greek Salad, Shrimp Risotto, grilled Octopus, Caesar Salad, and pork gyros (with French fries). All were excellent.

One word of caution:  Never order the daily special (fish) here without first asking for the price. They will gouge you with this if you're not careful.

places.generalDescription: If you're wandering through Mykonos, make sure to stop by Nice n Easy for a delightful dining experience. This charming eatery is conveniently located along the seafront and offers a fantastic selection of gluten-free options, making it perfect for health-conscious travelers. The ambiance is relaxed and inviting, ideal for enjoying a meal while soaking in stunning views of the water.

sources.snippet: Nice n easy is a very small chain of 3 restaurants across Greece that upholds a farm-to-table philosophy when it comes to dining. Located in Alefkandra Square, it has nice views of Little Venice.
sources.shortName: Little Venice, Mykonos's most romantic neighborhood

places.name: nice n easy

reviews.text: Delicious food, beautiful sunset views, and a really lovely atmosphere. The restaurant has so many great options to choose from, and everything we tried was amazing. The staff was incredibly kind and attentive, which made the experience even better. We went for a sunset dinner and it was the perfect spot-highly recommend if you're in Mykonos!

Nice n Easy in Mykonos was such a lovely surprise and definitely one of the best meals we had on the island. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, with a beautiful view and a laid-back vibe that makes you want to stay for hours.

The food was absolutely delicious. Everything we ordered tasted fresh and full of flavour. One of the highlights was the wild catch of the day, which was perfectly cooked and so fresh it felt like it came straight from the sea. You can tell they use high quality ingredients and put care into every dish.

The staff were genuinely warm and friendly, always checking in with a smile and happy to make recommendations. Service was fast but never rushed, and we felt really looked after from start to finish.

It's the kind of place that gets everything right without trying too hard. Great food, lovely service and a charming location all come together for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Mykonos who wants fresh, well-cooked food in a beautiful setting. We will definitely be coming back next time.

Very nice food and great atmosphere. View overlooking the sea. Shrimp orzo was particularly rich and tasty. The team were very welcoming and friendly. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting! Cheers to Dimitris and Georges for being awesome servers :)

sources.shortName: The best couple' guides to travel to Mykonos

reviews.text: Amazing massage! Vassiliki was my therapist and did a perfect job.  I asked for medium and got that exactly.  More pressure where it was necessary, and less in other spots.  Perfect end to my stay in Mykonos.  Thank you!!😊

Everything about my experience was lovely. I had never been to a spa before, but all the ladies were very kind and answered my many questions. My masseuses were fantastic and did a wonderful job at making me feel relaxed and at peace. If I ever come back to Mykonos, I would come here again. 10/10 recommend to those who enjoy a nice and relaxing spa day during their vacation.

We had such an amazing time in this salon. Denise and the “girls” were wonderful. A group of 6 girls we had from facial treatment to full body massage, we all felt like regenerated! Staff is so kind and knowledgeable, such a bliss! Thank you so much

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming Little Venice area of Mykonos town, Katerina's Restaurant & Cocktail Bar is a cozy eatery with a laid-back vibe. The restaurant boasts a terrace offering breathtaking sea views and specializes in delectable seafood dishes. With its colorful wooden balconies extending over the ocean, this spot provides an Italian city feel. Visitors can savor traditional Greek and Mediterranean cuisine along with an array of drinks and cocktails served right by the sea.

sources.snippet: If you want to see the Aegean Sea from a small balcony hanging over the water, book a place at Katerina’s in advance and have a taste of their artfully-served dishes.
sources.shortName: Little Venice, Mykonos's most romantic neighborhood

places.name: Katerina's Restaurant & Cocktail Bar

reviews.text: Sharing my experience walking into this cozy little place when I needed a coffee kick! The latte and the baklava with the perfect views watching the windmills and the sunset was one of the highlights of my trip!

I had the absolute pleasure of having lunch at Katerina Restaurant and it was an experience to remember.
I started with fresh sea urchins – a rare treat! For my main dish, I had the sea urchins risotto (yes, I am obsessed) and I truly adored every bite – perfectly cooked, rich in flavor and beautifully presented.
The ambiance is relaxed and authentic, the view is simply breathtaking and the staff makes you feel genuinely welcome from the moment you arrive.
You come here for the food but you leave with new friends. A heartfelt bravo to Katerina, the lovely owner, whose warmth and hospitality make this place so special.
Highly recommended – I'll definitely be back. Tomorrow :)!

Food was actually tasty we ordered lamb souvlaki & shrimp pasta, the cocktails however were average. It is very expensive but that is just Mykonos prices and you pay for relatively better taste and view. So if you don't mind the price it is actually quite good place for food & drink and nice views, but not exactly the wow feeling. *Be aware of the waves if you sit downstairs*

places.generalDescription: Bill & Coo Mykonos is a chic hotel offering modern suites, an upscale restaurant, an outdoor infinity pool, and a spa. It's known for its sparkling LED-lit pool, stellar service, and rooms with day-beds on a deck above their plunge pool. The Valmont spa offers facials and massages for party-ready skin or relaxation. Additionally, the hotel's sister site in Agios Ioannis features a Beefbar outpost on the beach.

sources.snippet: Further west still, check in to Bill & Coo Suites for the ultimate in sophistication, with views across to Delos.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds

sources.snippet: Offering honeymoon suites, private hot tubs and sea views, this hotel is a top choice for honeymooning couples or simply a romantic vacation. It’s up on a hill close to the center of Mykonos Town, so there are beautiful sunset views. More Details and Prices
sources.shortName: Honeymoon and Romantic Hotels in Mykonos

places.name: Bill&Coo Mykonos

reviews.text:
We stay frequently at luxury hotels around the world, but have never experienced friendlier service than what we received at Bill&Coo Mykonos.  Every interaction was met with a smile and genuine intent to help and make your stay more comfortable.

The location, 10 minutes walk to downtown is unbearable

The quality of rooms and amenities is world class.

Food at the pool bar is exquisite and the breakfast is simply outstanding.

Certainly a place to come back to!

This place is 10 of 10…no flaws.  The staff is extremely attentive.  My son (13) spent an hour in the spa, just living his best life (Thank you Yannis).

The location is a short walk to the old town, which is super convenient - close enough to have easy access (Parking can be a hassle downtown)

The breakfast is incredible.  Get the yogurt with fruit, granola and honey.  The eggs Benedict were tops for my kids - and the sweets menu!

We had one minor issue with the shower, and it was fixed quickly while we were out for the evening.

The staff was excellent. The food was great with the exception of the lobster pasta. Way over priced and almost no lobster. The most disappointing part was their booking policy. They make you pay 30 days in advance and when you have a change you're basically screwed. If it wasn't for there policy we would stay there again but as of now find another place with a better policy.

places.address: Bill & Coo Suites and Lounge Megali Ammos Beach, Mikonos 846 00, Greece

places.generalDescription: Mykonos Old Port is a bustling area with picturesque views, making it the most popular place to stay on the island. It offers a vibrant atmosphere with plenty of hotels and accommodations, as well as numerous shops, restaurants, and taverns. Visitors can explore the fish market for fresh seafood and enjoy fascinating exhibitions at the Archaeological Museum of Mykonos. This area is also home to iconic landmarks such as Little Venice and the Kato Mili Windmills.

sources.snippet: Mykonos is popular with travelers during the summertime, so there are regular ferry trips between Mykonos and other islands. All ferries dock at the New Port of Mykonos. The Mykonos Bus Service passes every 15 minutes and stops at Fabrika Bus Station.
sources.shortName: Little Venice, Mykonos's most romantic neighborhood

sources.siteName: Luxury Villa Rentals in Mykonos Greece
sources.shortName: Mykonos for Couples - The Ultimate Guide

places.name: Mykonos Old Port

reviews.text:
Arrived in Mykonos by cruise ship via a Sea bus taxi which shuttles you to the port itself for a small fee, a beautiful quaint little town with whitewashed buildings, narrow and clean streets.

The port was bustling with many restaurants, shops and cafe's, the people are warm and welcoming and spoke very good English...the Windmills of Mykonos on the hilltop is a must visit with beautiful panoramic views of the bay and little Venice.

I can see Mykonos being a favorite place to return to independently, and a visit is best in the middle of May with less crowds and a mild cool temperature.

Epic & Beautiful port
Arrived here to visit from a cruise ship and had hesitates to come out, but really after I arrived I realized I did the right choice. It was really nice the spectacular windmills & marvellous little harbour.
All worth it!

Amazing place to come visit for partying, the Gee-Ros/Gyros 🥹😉 and all the shopping you can do. The white ingenuity placed in the building, stores & homes of the locals is awesome. There is always something new to do & see here, walking through little Venice or an adventure to finding the windmills, never disappointed while I got lost multiple occasions & wasn't really worried because the definite path was always to the beach and making a left.

Can't wait to visit again🙏🏽🥹💙🩵🤍

places.generalDescription: Psarou beach is a picturesque destination with a lively sandy shoreline and clear green waters, offering various water sports and upscale facilities. The Kensho Beach Bar, an extension of the luxurious Kensho Psarou hotel, boasts extravagant features such as a lagoon swimming pool surrounded by rocks and palm trees, oversized parasols, and an award-winning Japanese and Peruvian-inspired menu. Visitors can explore nearby attractions like Little Venice for Grecian clothing shops and trendy boutiques.

sources.snippet: • Psarou beach: One of the most popular beaches on the island lies only 4 km from the Town (Chora). It is famous for its luxury beach bars, restaurants, and resorts.
sources.shortName: Best 15+ Things to Do in Mykonos

places.name: Psarou beach

reviews.text: Super fun! Went on the first day it was open so it was a little bit slower. Employees are weird about parking and saying it is a private beach and you have to use there service. It's not true, you just need to pay for parking! Easy access to drinks and a nice sandy beach fun for a day trip!
Gorgeous beach crystal clear water all your typical sun bed hire available but also plenty of room to sunbathe in the middle of the beach, life guard and a lively beach club on the far side

A wonderful beach with crystal clear waters. Lots of space for your own towels and beach umbrellas. The beach is compact which is nice. There's a great bar in the middle that serves traditional Greek and international food and drink.
The boats are parked far enough for you to enjoy watching them but still have plenty of room for swimming. Probably one of our favourite beaches on Mykonos.  The water is crystal clear with no corals or rocks. Very family friendly.

places.generalDescription: Paralia Agios Sostis, located 7.5 km away from Mykonos Town, is a serene and unspoiled beach that offers tranquility away from the bustling tourist crowds. Unlike many other beaches in Mykonos, Paralia Agios Sostis remains unorganized with only one tavern at its quiet end. This makes it an ideal destination for those who prefer a more laid-back and natural beach experience without the typical tourist luxuries like sunbeds and restaurants.

sources.snippet: If you are in search of an off-track beach, which is unorganized and too rushed with tourist crowds, this is the very place that you need to be headed towards. If you do not crave sunbeds and other tourist luxuries, this beautiful beach with golden sand will surely amaze you. The breathtaking views of the sea and the beautiful surroundings not only make a visit to this beach worth it but also provide ample solace and peace for you to get ready for a hectic tourist attraction hunting at Mykonos.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Mykonos for a Blissful Trip in 2024

places.name: Paralia Agios Sostis

reviews.text: One of the last virgin beaches of Mykonos! Perfect for swimming and sunbathing. If you want a beautiful and relaxing beach experience it's the perfect place. Better to go early cause it's very difficult to park a car.

Lovely beach. There are no sunbeds or umbrellas.
The views are nice, the sand is great. We thought we would stay 5/10 minutes just to visit, but we spent here the whole day. We had an umbrela for shade.
Bring you staff with you, as the parking is not on the beach.
We ended our day at the Kiki taverna.

Beautiful wild beach with fine sand and transparent waters full of fish! There are no beach clubs so go there prepared, the only place with food nearby is Kiki restaurant which is a tavern on a lovely spot but quite expensive and I found the food heavy and nothing special.

places.generalDescription: Paralia Ftelias is a serene seaside resort located on the rugged northern flank of Mykonos island. Despite being close to the bustling town of Ano Mera, it offers a peaceful escape with its tranquil beach and small coves for swimming and sunbathing. The area is popular among windsurfers due to the strong winds that create frothy waves, but there are also options for self-catering apartments and locally-sourced food in beach tavernas.
places.name: Paralia Ftelias

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I guess this beach can be very hit or miss. We came on a day when the wind was blowing from the South. There was a lot of little plastic bottle caps and scraps, but once we got closer, the beach was clean and the water beautiful!

This was the first beach i visited here in Mykonos, but i cant say it was the best. Yes, its not crowded ,clean water and you can bring snacks of your own but it was very windy. I was dissapointed to see the beach being dirty all over with trash which was sad. Also if you want to go swimming i recommend getting swimming shoes since there were alot if sharp rocks underwater and i got injured swimming. Overall i had a great time but i wouldnt go again ,there are better beaches to visit here:))

Beautiful gamely secluded place with small former archaeology dig site done the middle of the back beach. The water here is crystal clear. Loses a star because of the used condoms and bear bottles and cans.
When wind not coming from the north it is quite calm but can get very choppy when  it does

places.generalDescription: Mykonos, the third destination following Paris and Dubai, recently joined the establishment last summer while remaining faithful to its rich heritage; an exceptional combination of fashion, opulence, and refinement. The brunch in particular is exceptional, offering a generous selection of delectable cuisine with ample options to enjoy your favorite dishes. The staff exude both professionalism and a lively spirit, while the beverage selection is equally impressive.

sources.snippet: At Ornos Beach you’ll find plenty of tasty spots; La Cantine du Faubourg is one of the latest. After opening in Paris more than two decades ago it took over Dubai, opening a staggering 11 restaurants and beach clubs in the glitzy Emirate since 2015, and has now set eyes on Mykonos: doors here opened in 2022 serving eager diners a Japanese-Mediterranean menu. Nearby, Apaggio is an easy-going seafood spot with a view, and the menu at Mykonos Social by Jason Atherton is inspired by his years of traveling around the Greek islands.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds

places.name: La Cantine du Faubourg Mykonos

reviews.text: Went there with a group of 6. We received a warm welcome from the parking lot. Starting from the bar we had unique and flavourful cocktails. Great suggestions for the food from our waiter Anna and the whole staff was constantly making sure we had a great time. Perfect for dinner with your significant other.

We had the pleasure to experience, their services, drinks, and dishes. Everything was incredibly well-done! The view of the sea is spectacular ! It's an impeccable  restaurant. The mix of Italian, Mediterranean, japanese.. From the black cot, to sushi, to pizza... This experience left us with the desire to go back again... Lastly the employees were amazing, they explained every dish, they were kind, as well professional offering personalized experiences! I conclude saying that it has my utmost recommendations!

La Cantine in Mykonos has quickly become my absolute favorite restaurant on the island. The place is incredibly beautiful, with a captivating ambiance, enchanting music, and breathtaking sunset views. The fusion of French and Greek cuisine on their menu is a culinary masterpiece, offering a delightful mix of flavors. The impeccable service provided by the friendly and attentive staff adds to the exceptional dining experience. This is a MUST-visit destination!! I can't wait to return again and again!!

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Laka - Tavern is a culinary gem located in the heart of Mykonos, offering a delightful blend of traditional Greek cuisine and a warm, inviting ambiance. This hidden treasure has garnered popularity among both locals and tourists, making it a must-visit destination. While some reviewers noted that the food lacked seasoning, others praised the delicious variety of grilled and vegan options. Visitors raved about the exceptional service and recommended dishes like meatballs in sauce for their tenderness and home-cooked feel.

sources.snippet: Mykonos Essence Hotel - Soul Bar - Restaurant: Even if you aren't staying here (which I recommend you do!) this restaurant is delicious and worth a stop one evening. If you can't make dinner, consider it for a pre-dinner drink.
sources.shortName: Have a Romantic Honeymoon in Mykonos, Greece

places.name: Restaurant Laka - Tavern

reviews.text: The best masaka! Clasic and the one with pastitio! The stuff is very friendly, the owner is so nice and the place has such a good vibe. Price is ok reported to the quality of the food. You will not regret it!
This place was so yummy and delicious and the service was so good. The server was so nice and I definitely recommend coming here.

Excellent restaurant wonderful food
The host was so personal and courteous
Delicious authentic cuisine in the heart of Mykonos🧿🤍

places.generalDescription: Kalua Beach Bar-Restaurant is a relaxed club situated on Paraga beach in Mykonos, offering a blend of Japanese fusion cuisine, lively DJ performances, and an inviting cocktail bar. With over 15 years of history, the venue has recently undergone a revitalizing transformation. It now serves as an idyllic setting for exchanging vows by the beach and hosting receptions in its covered outdoor area.

sources.snippet: Pair your spree with afternoon-lounging turned late-night partying at one of the many beach clubs in the area; there’s neighboring Nammos, of course, but Scorpios, Kalua, and Super Paradise are also nearby.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds

places.name: Kalua Beach Bar-Restaurant

reviews.text:
Absolutely buzzing atmosphere!
The drinks were spot on - perfectly refreshing.
We ordered a burger, and to be honest, I didn't expect it to taste that good - incredibly juicy and delicious.
By the afternoon, the party vibe was in full swing.
Highly recommended!

this place is great, has a chill vibe that keeps progressing as the day goes on. most of the afternoon was chill lounge music, you talk to the person next to you and still hear them. then around 4:30-5:00 it gets more hyped up like a traditional beach club. for the sunbeds, it's $50 per person with $80 minimum spending per person. the drinks average about $20-$25 as expected for a beach club, the food was great, worth the money. it's expensive but worth it. the service was fantastic

Kalua Beach Bar Mykonos: A Vibe Like No Other!

If you're looking for the perfect blend of beachside relaxation, electrifying energy, and mouthwatering food, Kalua Beach Bar in Mykonos is the place to be! From the moment you step onto the sand, you're immediately embraced by the island's vibrant and carefree atmosphere.

The vibe at Kalua is like nothing else on the island. During the day, it's the perfect spot to kick back and enjoy a cold drink while soaking in the sun. But as the sun sets, the energy shifts. The place transforms into a lively hotspot with the rhythm of music filling the air, creating an irresistible party vibe. The music is upbeat, setting the tone for an unforgettable evening.

The food is just as impressive as the vibe. Whether you're in the mood for a light bite or a full-on feast, Kalua delivers! Fresh seafood, delicious Greek dishes, and tasty cocktails that perfectly complement the beach setting. The portions are generous, and the quality of ingredients speaks for itself - everything tastes as good as it looks.

But what truly sets Kalua apart is the live entertainment. The singer is a fantastic addition, with a voice that's both captivating and energizing, creating an ambiance that has you swaying to the tunes. And don't get me started on the dancers - they absolutely own the stage. With their lively choreography, they bring the place to life and get everyone on their feet, dancing along to the rhythm.

Would definitely go there again.

places.generalDescription: RARITY GALLERY, located in the heart of Mykonos, is a contemporary art gallery that has been showcasing the work of international artists since 1994. Founded by Vassilis Matsaidonis and Christos Nikolaou, it offers a diverse selection of artworks from emerging talents to established names such as Julian Opie, Mel Ramos, Yigal Ozeri, and more. The gallery also features exhibitions of sculptors like Hanneke Beaumont and Sean Henry.

sources.snippet: On the edge of the old town section of Hora, this small gallery in a lovely historic manor house has ever-changing exhibitions of top contemporary painting, photography, design and more. Nearby, you’ll find several more galleries with works for sale, such as Art and Soul, which has been catering to high-end collectors for more than three decades. The gallery often showcases works from emerging artists, making it a great spot to discover new talent.
sources.shortName: 20 best things to do in Mykonos

sources.siteName: Luxury Villa Rentals in Mykonos Greece
sources.shortName: Mykonos for Couples - The Ultimate Guide

places.name: RARITY GALLERY

reviews.text:
We had to go here because it was a recommended spot on tripadvisor. It's pretty cool and one of the better galleries that we walked into. The owners are pleasant and even though they don't like people taking pictures - if you ask them, they're pretty cool about it.

The girl standing in the corner really tripped me out - the mannequins all look very real and that one girl that's stuck taking off her sweater is perfectly placed in the gallery.

Really cool, free, modern art museum.  There are several rooms with a great range of work by some pretty big modern artists! Every room had a guide and they really were eager to tell us about the art so we got over our shyness and learned a lot more as a result :) definitely worth checking out as it's super conveniently placed and completely free!
Very nice gallery with contemporary art -photography, painting and sculptures. It's free, so you can walk in and enjoy some art in the middle of Mykonos alleys.

places.generalDescription: The Ace VIP Villas in Mykonos offer luxurious accommodations with stunning sunset views and close proximity to top restaurants, just a 10-minute drive from Chora. Additionally, they provide yacht rental services for those looking to indulge. The team at Ace VIP is praised for their efficient and professional service, ensuring smooth vacation planning and securing reservations at fully booked venues. Guests appreciate the seamless organization of villa rentals and bookings, making for stress-free holidays.

sources.snippet: There’s nothing that can beat the lavishness of private villas in Mykonos, and The Ace VIP has the top-rated listing on the island to offer. Choose among our numerous stunning Mykonos villas for rental, and contact us to book your stay!
sources.siteName: Luxury Villa Rentals in Mykonos Greece
sources.shortName: Mykonos for Couples - The Ultimate Guide

places.name: The Ace VIP Villas

reviews.text: I've traveled worldwide and experienced many VIP concierge services, but Mane and his team are hands down the best I've experienced. From the amazing accommodation and ensuring all our group's needs were seamlessly met to security, transportation, and getting the absolute best at any restaurant or venue we went to, I can't recommend this service ENOUGH to the most discerning clients. If we had any issues or questions, within a matter of minutes, they were taken care of. See you again soon, Mane, I will definitely be a lifelong client!

We booked through The Ace VIP and it completely leveled up our trip. The villa was stunning, sea view, a private pool, epic sound system, and even a DJ booth. The concierge team was on point: they arranged everything from a private chef to yacht rentals. They also sorted us out with VIP tables at Scorpios and Cavo Paradiso, no lines, no stress. It was one of those trips you never forget. Worth every bit.

Our July trip couldn't have been more perfect!! The villa was absolutely gorgeous, honestly even better than the photos. The concierge team took care of all our family plans without a hitch, and Mane and his team truly went above and beyond. They exceeded every expectation we had

places.generalDescription: Cine Manto Mykonos offers a unique cinematic adventure that combines the magic of film with the beauty of nature. Nestled in the Municipal Garden, this open-air cinema is surrounded by lush palm trees and cacti, creating an enchanting atmosphere under the twinkling Aegean stars. From June 1 to September 30, movie lovers can indulge in two screenings daily, featuring a mix of box office hits and classic films presented in their original language with Greek subtitles.

sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do in Mykonos, According to Local Experts

sources.snippet: Luckily, Cine Manto in town offers a romantic environment underneath the stars, where movie enthusiasts can happily gather to watch classic and blockbuster movies screening daily.
sources.shortName: Best 15+ Things to Do in Mykonos

places.name: Cine Manto Mykonos

reviews.text:
Beautiful concept of open cinema outside where you can bring your own snacks or buy them at the inside bar.
we come to see the movie "Sing Sing" which was great, the audio was good especially considering there's a big noisy restaurant just on the other side.
each ticket per person cost 10 euro and 4 euro for small popcorn.

A beautiful outdoor cinema experience in Mykonos. The place feels cosy and the sound quality is quite impeccable. Watching a film under the stars is not what I expected to do in Mykonos but it ended up being one of the highlights.

It was an absolutely delightful experience. The sound system at the cinema was top-notch, ensuring a truly immersive movie-watching experience. The food served was not only delicious but also served promptly, allowing us to enjoy our meal without any delays. As for the movie itself, it was nothing short of amazing, captivating us from beginning to end. The entire venue exuded a charming and adorable ambiance, making it stand out amidst the beauty of the entire island of Mykonos.

One particular highlight was the presence of a serene fish pond located adjacent to the canteen. Its presence added a touch of tranquility and enhanced the overall ambiance of the place. Additionally, the cinema cleverly included an intermission during the movie, which I found to be a valuable feature. This break provided an opportunity to stretch our legs, grab some snacks, and refresh ourselves, ultimately enhancing the cinema experience.

Overall, this unique cinema experience was truly remarkable, setting itself apart from the rest of Mykonos Island's attractions.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the stunning Ornos Bay, Santa Marina, a Luxury Collection Resort, Mykonos is a high-end haven that perfectly blends elegance and comfort. This exquisite resort boasts 101 sea-view rooms and suites, many featuring private plunge pools, alongside 13 luxurious villas for those seeking extra space. Guests can indulge in delightful dining options and rejuvenate at the spa while enjoying access to a unique private beach—an exclusive feature on the island.

sources.snippet: But first you’ll need to determine why you’re in Mykonos: if your main goal is to party ‘til the small hours then the town center is where you need to be; for the ultimate resort experience that’s both party- and family-friendly, centrally located yet private right in Ornos Bay, Santa Marina Mykonos makes our Gold List. For a more relaxed, beachy escape (that still offers plenty to do) head south; for utter seclusion, the east of the island calls.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Mykonos—and How to Skirt the Crowds

places.name: Santa Marina, a Luxury Collection Resort, Mykonos

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Santa Marina for our anniversary. The Santa Marina experience began from the moment we walked in. Each and every staff member is ready to serve. Anytime we wanted something sent to our room, transportation, recommendations, reservations, etc. the team was there ready to help. The rooms are cleaned throughout the day and our view of the ocean was spectacular! There is a beach on the premises where you can relax all day if you'd like and go for a swim in the beautiful ocean. The hotel is about a 10 minute drive from the main town, which is very convenient.

Absolutely stunning resort with exceptional service, food, style and class! The spa was top notch! Try the Hammi massage! It is a unique experience. However, you cannot go wrong with any of the treatments. They have true trained and talented massage therapists. The staff caterers to each guest. This resort is a stand alone jewel and worth every penny!

Last week, we visited the Santa Marina for the 5th time since 2019. This property is a jewel - easily one of our favorites in the world.

The beach staff (especially Frederiki and Lorena) are fantastic, and are so warm and loving toward our toddler. The breakfast crew remembers where we like to sit and the way we take our coffees. The details like the linens and serving dishes are tasteful and perfectly executed.

Every year has been great, but this summer was the best yet. All of the little details were even more finely tuned, the food was even more exquisite than in years past, and the service was truly exceptional.

It was so good I felt compelled to write a note to management complimenting them on how an already great place had somehow achieved perfection this summer.

Can't wait to come back for years to come.

places.generalDescription: The Archaeological Museum of Mykonos, located in Chora, offers a fascinating journey through the island's history. The museum houses a diverse collection of artifacts dating back to the 25th century BC, including urns, funerary art, figurines, and jewelry. Visitors can explore relics that depict Mykonos' tumultuous past and battle-filled history.

sources.snippet: An essential stop before you take the short boat trip to Delos, this museum in Hora showcases ancient objects collected from the sacred island as well as other remarkable finds such as a beautiful marble torso of Hercules dating to the 2nd century BCE. The museum’s collection includes artifacts that span several periods of Greek history, offering a comprehensive overview of the region’s past. Watch for creative rotating exhibitions that pair artifacts with contemporary art.
sources.shortName: 20 best things to do in Mykonos
16 Best Things To Do in Mykonos, According to Local Experts

sources.snippet: These should be some of your sightseeing priorities – if you have more time and want to expand this list, you’ll find plenty of other Mykonos attractions just by wandering around the charming streets of Chora. You’ll be amazed by the beauty of Cycladic architecture!
sources.siteName: Luxury Villa Rentals in Mykonos Greece
sources.shortName: Mykonos for Couples - The Ultimate Guide

places.name: Archaeological Museum of Mykonos

reviews.text: 4 euros per adult; kids free. Cool little museum with interesting pottery and stories of how things were discovered.

We went in October, the off season so no lines and plenty of time and space to wander at our leisure.
The text panels are in Greek and English. There's plenty of info for what we were looking at. It was a great addition if you do an excursion to Delos island.
The person at the desk was very knowledgeable and answered our questions. There are toilets available but they were not the greatest, doesn't matter tho at least they worked.

Wonderful little museum and some very fascinating history on display for Mykonos and the surrounding islands. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars was because there was an over abundance of similar exhibits (would be nice to have a little more variety) and the toilets were missing seats in the bathrooms.

sources.shortName: Unforgettable Things to Do for Couples

reviews.text: Nick is an incredibly talented photographer! Super friendly & helpful with directions, flexible with timing, & always delivers content on time. Best experience I've had & will work with Nick again for sure!
Did my maternity pictures and he did amazing would definitely recommend if your looking for an amazing photographer!!

I had the pleasure of working with Nick for a professional photoshoot when in Mykonos, and I couldn't be happier with the experience and the results. From start to finish, Nick was incredibly professional, attentive, and accommodating, ensuring that every detail was perfect.

The photos themselves were simply stunning. Nick has a remarkable talent for capturing moments and emotions, and the final images exceeded all my expectations. The lighting, composition, and attention to detail in each shot were exceptional, resulting in a collection of photos that I will cherish for years to come.

I highly recommend Nick for anyone looking for a talented and professional photographer in Mykonos. Five stars!

places.generalDescription: Paraga beach is a serene and unspoiled destination, free from the typical trappings of commercialized beaches. Here, visitors won't find lounge chairs, umbrellas, or bustling beach clubs. Instead, they can enjoy the tranquility of the surroundings with only a monastery atop a hill and Kikis taverna halfway up offering simple yet delicious meals. The absence of crowds allows for a peaceful experience, especially in October when temperatures are still warm enough for swimming.

sources.snippet: Ten minutes after you arrive on Mykonos you can enjoy a perfect day of sun-soaked relaxation on Paraga Beach. Beach clubs offer beachside food and drink as well as loungers and gear for watersports. Scorpios Beach Club is one of the best, providing a premium beachside experience with comfortable sunbeds, umbrellas and attentive service.
sources.shortName: 20 best things to do in Mykonos

places.name: Paraga beach

reviews.text:
Great beach! Pristine water and nice vibe.
The con of this beach is that it it small and covered of sunbeds, but the nature is amazing!

P.S.: Scorpio's is a cool club for sunset and partying but not to spend the day (paricularly if you like clear waters). The beach if front of Scorpio's is not even comparable to the main Paraga beach.
Very nice wide beach. Quiet, near to other more ‘party beaches'. Paracha beach is more about sun , water sports and relaxation.

Where there is a paid zone with umbrellas in the sea there are practically no waves and less wind, because it is as if in a corner. But where it is free there are already waves and wind. The free part of the beach area has some trees to take shade under. There was a peacock and chickens. There was also garbage.
